results.title: Exploring the night sky
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A class-room film explaining the nature of stars and constellations and demonstrating the operation of an observatory telescope. Uses animation to identify the characters and shapes associated with constellations, explaining why they appear to be changing positions in the sky. Points out that the distances between stars and planets is not expressed in miles but light years.

results.title: Exploring the human nervous system
results.brief_description: The advances being made in research into the workings of the human nervous system. The nervous system itself is described by means of animated drawings. Also indicates what is being done to understand memory and learning. Compares the nervous systems of the hydra and the earth worm with the complex human nervous system.

results.title: Exploring the atomic nucleus
results.brief_description: Protons and neutrons are now known to be composed of dozens of other particles whose interactions have yet to be accurately described. Physicists are detecting and analysing particle interactions with the aid of particle accelerators, bubble chambers and other sophisticated devices of high energy physics, thus arriving at a fuller understanding of the atomic nucleus.

results.title: Exploring space: the sun and its energy. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Media and Lee W. Gluckman
results.brief_description: Uses simulation to show the space shuttle Enterprise placing a solar observatory into orbit. Describes the sun’s physical characteristics, explains its effect on earth and briefly the possibilities of solar energy.

results.title: Exploring New Zealand's fiordland
results.creator_credit: Stanhope Andrews and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A joint expedition of New Zealand and American research workers into New Zealand’s fiordlands to study fauna and flora and to prepare maps of the area. Narrated by Briton Chadwick.

results.title: Exploring mathematics: the weird number
results.brief_description: Presents an amusing introduction of rational numbers to a community of natural numbers. The weird number, 2/3, steals a piece of cake and then leads the major and the baker on a merry chase. Suitable middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Exploring mathematics. Lost in the mish-mosh: area measure
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon in which Finite Sums and Dr Whatsup rescue a professor by solving a problem of area measure. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.
